meanings.definition: To forecast or predict future events.
meanings.sent1: I can prognosticate the weather by looking at the clouds.
meanings.sent2: She likes to prognosticate about who will win the game.
meanings.sent3: Trying to prognosticate if the cat will catch the laser pointer is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The old man could prognosticate the outcome of any horse race.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to prognosticate the stock market trends is truly impressive.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction based on present indications.
meanings.sent1: Based on the dark clouds, I can prognosticate rain later.
meanings.sent2: He can prognosticate the winner of the competition just by observing the participants.
meanings.sent3: It's funny to prognosticate if the cookie jar will be empty by the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: She could always prognosticate trouble when her brother had that mischievous look.
meanings.sent5: The detective could prognosticate the culprit's next move with uncanny accuracy.
